context: The console was first officially announced at E3 2005, and was released at the end of <a0_0><b10_0>2006<b10_0/><a0_0/>. It was the first console to use Blu-ray Disc as its primary storage medium. The console was the first PlayStation to integrate social gaming services, included it being the first to introduce Sony's social gaming service, <a1_0><b11_0>PlayStation Network<b11_0/><a1_0/>, and its remote connectivity with PlayStation Portable and PlayStation Vita, being able to remote control the console from the devices. In <b7_0>September 2009<b7_0/>, the <a2_0><b12_0>Slim<b12_0/><a2_0/> model of the <b6_0>PlayStation <b5_0>3<b6_0/><b5_0/> was released, being lighter and thinner than the original version, which notably featured a redesigned logo and marketing design, as well as a minor start-up change in software. A <b9_0>Super Slim<b9_0/> variation was then released in late <a3_0><b13_0>2012<b13_0/><a3_0/>, further refining and redesigning the console. As of March 2016, PlayStation 3 has sold <a4_0><b8_0><b14_0>85 million<b14_0/><b8_0/><a4_0/> units worldwide. Its successor, the PlayStation 4, was released later in November 2013.
